intro: Zosterophyllanthos cardiothallis, commonly known as the heart-thallus zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant belonging to the order Zosterophylloideae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a central stem with branching structures that resemble a heart shape, giving it its common name. The plant exhibits a complex vascular system, suggesting an advanced level of evolution for its time. It is typically found in specific coastal environments, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable subject for studying early plant evolution.
